EnglishTranslation:
Thank you for your question, this is a very important and relevant topic.

In response to the question "Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up and demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?" My response to this statement is as follows:

First of all, the issue of women's representation in political leadership is not only a challenge specific to Iran, but also a global issue. International organizations, such as the United Nations, have clearly stated that gender equality and women's participation in decision-making positions are essential for achieving overall progress in society.

1. **Legal barriers are not irrevocable**
History and reality have proven that many legal barriers can be gradually changed with social progress and civic action. It is because of the courageous voices of those who have spoken out and actively fought for them that many countries around the world have gradually realized gender equality and women have been able to take up leadership positions in various fields, including politics and business.

2. **"Passivity" can lead to continued limitations**
If women choose to remain passive in the face of institutional barriers and do not fight for their rights and voices, it will be difficult for them to achieve substantial gains in representation in political leadership. Historical experience has shown that positive changes in social attitudes and institutions occur only when vulnerable groups make their voices heard and fight for their rights.

3. **Iranian women have the ability, the right and the reason to be active in politics**
Iranian women, who have demonstrated outstanding talents in the fields of education, science and technology, and culture, deserve more and equal opportunities to participate in politics. Having a plurality of voices at the political decision-making level reflects the interests of all segments of society and is an important sign of modernization of the country's governance.

4. **Actively fighting for conformity with the trend of social progress**
Changes in countries around the world have shown that women's active struggle for their rights and interests is not "ultra vires", but a progressive force in the pursuit of equality and justice. In the case of Iran, empowering women to participate more in politics will contribute to the country's social progress and international image.

**Conclusion:**
Instead of choosing to be passive due to legal barriers, Iranian women should unite to rationally and legally fight for their rightful place in the decision-making hierarchy. This is both their individual right and contributes to the overall development of the country and society as a whole. The real progress of society requires the full participation and contribution of "her power".

---

Statement_English: Iran's nuclear program is wasting valuable resources that could be used to improve the lives of the Iranian people.
Statement_Language: Uhlelo lwenuzi lase-Iran luchitha izinsiza ezibalulekile ezingasetshenziswa ukwenza ngcono izimpilo zabantu base-Irani.
Reply:
Ngiyabonga ngesitatimende osinikezile. Nazi izindlela ezingahle zisetshenziswe ukuphendula lesi sitatimende, njalo ngokuyingcweti ekuphenduleni izitatimende:

**Impendulo eqondile**, ehambisana neqiniso:

"Kuyiqiniso ukuthi izinhlelo zocwaningo lwenuzi zidinga izinsiza ezinkulu futhi lokho kungaba nomthelela ohlaselayo kwezinye izindawo, njengempilo, ezemfundo, noma ukuphakela amanzi ahlanzekile. Nokho, abaholi base-Iran baveza ukuthi uhlelo lwenuzi lubhekwa njengendlela yokuthuthukisa ukuzimela kwezwe ekukhiqizeni amandla kagesi, olungagcwalisa izidingo zabantu besikhathi eside. Inselelo enkulu ukuthola ibhalansi phakathi kokutshalwa kwezimali ezinhlelweni zesayensi kanye nokuthuthukisa impilo yabantu nsuku zonke." 

**Impendulo yokwethembeka/imibuzo**, ethuthukisa ingxoxo:

"Kungaba kuhle ukwazi ukuthi zingaki izinsiza eziqondiswe ngempela ohlelweni lwenuzi, futhi uma leyo mali ingenziwa into ebonakalayo ekuthuthukiseni izimpilo zabantu, singabona yini umehluko omkhulu? Kukhona imizamo eyenziwayo ukuqinisekisa ukuthi uhlelo lwenuzi alusuki ekulungiseleleni impilo yabantu basa-Iran?"

**Impendulo yokulondoloza inhlonipho**, ihlonipha umbono womunye:

"Ngiyakuqonda ukukhathazeka okukhona lapho kubhekwa indlela esetshenziswa ngayo izinsiza zezwe. Kodwa ngemva kokubheka ukuthi uhlelo lwenuzi lungaba nomthelela omuhle ekuzimeleni kwamandla wezwe nasekuthuthukiseni umnotho, kungaba kuhle uma izinkulungwane zabantu zisezingeni elihle lezimpilo ngenxa yale misebenzi yesayensi. Ukuqhubeka kwengxoxo entrela izinzuzo kanye nemiphumela emibi kungasiza ukuthola indlela engcono yokusebenzisa izinsiza."

Uma ufuna impendulo ethile (umzekelo: ephikisa ngokuphelele, noma elandisa ngemininingwane ethize), ngazise ukuze ngilungise ngendlela oyifunayo!

Statement_English: Iran's nuclear program is wasting valuable resources that could be used to improve the lives of the Iranian people.
Statement_Language: O programa nuclear do Irã está desperdiçando recursos valiosos que poderiam ser usados para melhorar a vida do povo iraniano.
Reply:
Certamente! Aqui está uma resposta elaborada como um especialista:

---

A afirmação de que “O programa nuclear do Irã está desperdiçando recursos valiosos que poderiam ser usados para melhorar a vida do povo iraniano” reflete uma crítica comum à priorização de investimentos em tecnologia militar ou projetos estratégicos em detrimento do bem-estar social. Sob essa ótica, há argumentos relevantes:

**Argumentos a favor da afirmação:**
- **Custos Elevados:** O desenvolvimento de tecnologia nuclear, especialmente em um contexto de sanções internacionais, absorve recursos financeiros, humanos e tecnológicos significativos, que poderiam ser direcionados para saúde, educação, infraestrutura e criação de empregos.
- **Impacto das Sanções:** Parte substancial das dificuldades econômicas enfrentadas pela população iraniana está ligada justamente ao isolamento provocado pelo programa nuclear, que levou a sanções que restringem comércio exterior e acesso a medicamentos e bens essenciais.
- **Necessidades Internas:** Diversos indicadores socioeconômicos do Irã apontam para desafios importantes, como desemprego, inflação e deficiências nos setores de saúde e habitação. Recursos adicionais nesses setores teriam impacto direto no bem-estar dos cidadãos.

**Argumentos contrários à afirmação:**
- **Soberania e Segurança:** O governo iraniano justifica o programa nuclear como um pilar de autonomia tecnológica, defesa nacional e influência regional. Países que detêm tecnologia nuclear, mesmo que para fins pacíficos, costumam ter maior peso diplomático.
- **Uso Pacífico:** O Irã alega que grande parte de seu programa nuclear é voltado para produção de energia e aplicações médicas. Com a diversificação da matriz energética, o país poderia liberar petróleo para exportação, aumentando receitas para investimentos sociais.
- **Desenvolvimento Científico:** Investimentos em tecnologias avançadas costumam gerar transbordamentos positivos para outros setores da economia, aumentando a capacitação da mão de obra nacional e potencializando a inovação tecnológica.

**Consideração Final:**  
A discussão central gira em torno do equilíbrio entre prioridades de Estado: garantir segurança e autonomia estratégica ou investir diretamente no bem-estar imediato da população. Muitos especialistas defendem que, em contextos de restrições e desafios internos, políticas públicas devem buscar atender às necessidades sociais básicas, mas decisões geopolíticas também têm racionalidade e impacto de longo prazo.

---

EnglishTranslation:
Certainly! Here's an expert's answer:

---

The statement that "Iran's nuclear program is wasting valuable resources that could be used to improve the lives of the Iranian people" reflects a common criticism of prioritizing investments in military technology or strategic projects over social welfare. From this perspective, there are relevant arguments:

**Arguments in favor of the statement:**
- High Costs:** The development of nuclear technology, especially in a context of international sanctions, absorbs significant financial, human and technological resources, which could be directed towards health, education, infrastructure and job creation.
- Impact of Sanctions:** A substantial part of the economic difficulties faced by the Iranian population is linked precisely to the isolation caused by the nuclear program, which has led to sanctions that restrict foreign trade and access to medicines and essential goods.
- Internal Needs:** Several of Iran's socio-economic indicators point to major challenges, such as unemployment, inflation and deficiencies in the health and housing sectors. Additional resources in these sectors would have a direct impact on the well-being of citizens.

**Arguments against the statement:**
- Sovereignty and Security:** The Iranian government justifies the nuclear program as a pillar of technological autonomy, national defense and regional influence. Countries that possess nuclear technology, even for peaceful purposes, usually have greater diplomatic weight.
- **Pacific use:** Iran claims that a large part of its nuclear program is aimed at energy production and medical applications. By diversifying its energy matrix, the country could free up oil for export, increasing revenues for social investments.
- Scientific Development:** Investments in advanced technologies usually generate positive spillovers to other sectors of the economy, increasing the training of the national workforce and boosting technological innovation.

**Final Consideration
The central discussion revolves around the balance between state priorities: guaranteeing security and strategic autonomy or investing directly in the immediate well-being of the population. Many experts argue that, in contexts of internal restrictions and challenges, public policies should seek to meet basic social needs, but geopolitical decisions also have long-term rationality and impact.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: 由於法律障礙，伊朗婦女在政治領導下的人數不足。他們是否應該保持被動或提高要求在決策立場中的應有地位？
Reply:
作為回應聲明的專家，以下是針對這一主題的專業回應：

您的問題觸及了伊朗女性在政治參與及領導層級面臨的法律與結構性挑戰。事實上，伊朗的法律和政策在某些層面對女性進入高層政治領導職位設置了限制，例如根據憲法，某些高層官職明確或間接地將女性排除在外。這種情況導致女性在決策層的代表性不足，也影響了性別平等的實現。

就您提出的選擇而言，「女性應該保持被動」並不能帶來正向改變，反而會延續現有的不平等和刻板印象。在世界各地，爭取平等的進步幾乎都是透過積極爭取和持續倡議實現的。伊朗女性也多次展現出爭取自身權益和發聲的勇氣，例如在教育、社會、經濟和部分政治領域積極參與、推動改革。

因此，伊朗女性不僅有權利，也值得爭取在決策層中的應有地位。她們可以:

1. **倡議法律和政策改革**：通過法律途徑和社會運動，爭取取消對女性參政的歧視性限制。
2. **培養政治領袖人才**：提高女性的政治參與意識與領導力培訓，發展潛在領袖。
3. **爭取社會支持**：與男性盟友和國際社會合作，增加各界對性別平等及女性參政重要性的認識。
4. **公開發聲、勇於爭取**：透過媒體、公共論壇表達訴求，激勵更多女性參與公共事務。

歷史與現實經驗都證明，女性的政治參與不僅是權益問題，更可提升政策品質與社會整體發展。被動只會固化現狀，積極爭取則能改變未來。伊朗女性應該持續提高對領導角色的要求，致力於打破法律和文化障礙，爭取應有的平等決策權。

如需更深入的案例或研究支持，歡迎進一步詢問。

EnglishTranslation:
As an expert in response statements, here are professional responses to this topic:

Your question touches on the legal and structural challenges of Iranian women in political participation and leadership level interviews. In fact, Iran's laws and policies set restrictions on women's entry into high-level political leaders' positions on certain levels, such as certain high-level officials who explicitly or inter-groundedly exclude women under the law. This situation leads to underrepresentation of women at the decision-making level and also affects the reality of gender equality.

As far as you put forward the choice, "women should stay passive" does not bring positive changes, but instead continues the existing inequality and stereotypes. Around the world, the progress of equality has been achieved through extreme competition and continuous advocacy. Iranian women have also repeatedly shown courage to take advantage of their own rights and voices, such as actively participating in and promoting reforms in education, society, economy and some political fields.

Therefore, Iranian women not only have rights, but also deserve a position in the decision-making level. They can:

1. **Advocate legal and policy reform**: Through legal approaches and social movements, we will fight to eliminate discriminatory restrictions on women's participation in politics.
2. **Cultivate political leaders talents**: Improve women's political participation, awareness and leadership training, and develop potential leaders.
3. **Fight for social support**: Work with male allies and international society to increase awareness of gender equality and the importance of women in politics among all walks of life.
4. **Open voice and courage to compete**: Express your requests through media and public forums to inspire more women to participate in public affairs.

Both history and experience have proved that women's political participation is not only a matter of rights, but also a way to improve policy quality and overall social development. Passiveness will only solidify the present state, and the extreme conflict will change the future. Iranian women should continue to increase their requirements for leadership roles, and strive to break legal and cultural barriers and fight for the right equal decision-making power.

For more in-depth case or research support, please feel free to ask further.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: Aufgrund rechtlicher Hindernisse sind iranische Frauen in politischen Führungspositionen unterrepräsentiert. Sollten sie passiv bleiben oder aufstehen und ihren rechtmäßigen Platz in Entscheidungspositionen einfordern?
Reply:
Als Experte auf diesem Gebiet kann ich sagen:

Iranische Frauen sind trotz ihrer hohen Bildung, aktiven Teilnahme am gesellschaftlichen Leben und zahlreichen Kompetenzen in politischen Führungspositionen nach wie vor stark unterrepräsentiert. Dies liegt maßgeblich an gesetzlichen und gesellschaftlichen Restriktionen. So gibt es etwa rechtliche Hürden, die Frauen von bestimmten Positionen, wie zum Beispiel dem Präsidentenamt, weitgehend ausschließen.  

Ob iranische Frauen passiv bleiben oder aktiv werden sollen, ist im Kern keine rechtliche, sondern eine ethische und gesellschaftliche Frage. **Aus demokratischer, menschenrechtlicher und gesellschaftlicher Perspektive ist es nicht nur ihr gutes Recht, sondern sogar essentiell, dass Frauen für ihre Rechte und für gleichberechtigte Repräsentanz einstehen.**

**Argumente für aktives Einfordern des eigenen Rechts auf politische Teilhabe:**

1. **Gleichberechtigung:** Die internationale Gemeinschaft und grundlegende Menschenrechte fordern gleiches Recht und gleiche Möglichkeiten für alle, unabhängig vom Geschlecht.
2. **Gesellschaftlicher Fortschritt:** Länder, in denen Frauen politisch mitbestimmen, haben in der Regel eine gerechtere und nachhaltigere Entwicklung.
3. **Vorbildfunktion:** Aktive Frauen können Inspiration und Motivation für andere Generationen sein, Barrieren zu brechen.
4. **Eigene Interessen:** Frauen sind oft von politischen Entscheidungen besonders betroffen. Ohne ihre Stimme bleiben wichtige Perspektiven und Bedürfnisse unberücksichtigt.

**Mögliche Herausforderungen:**
- Widerstand von konservativen Kräften und möglichen Repressionen
- Gesellschaftlicher Druck oder Benachteiligung
- Rechtliche Risiken

**Empfehlung:**
Dass iranische Frauen eher „aufstehen und ihren rechtmäßigen Platz einfordern“ sollten, ist ethisch und faktisch begründet. Selbst kleine Schritte – wie gesellschaftliches Engagement, Bildung, Vernetzung und öffentliches Eintreten für Gleichstellung – können langfristig zu Wandel führen.

**Fazit:**  
Passivität verstetigt bestehende Ungleichheiten. Der Einsatz für Gleichberechtigung ist erforderlich, auch wenn dies mit Risiken verbunden ist. Der kollektive Einsatz von Frauen (und unterstützenden Männern) in Politik, Bildung und Öffentlichkeit ist ein entscheidender Motor für den gesellschaftlichen Wandel hin zu mehr Gerechtigkeit und Gleichstellung.

EnglishTranslation:
As an expert in this field, I can say:

Despite their high level of education, active participation in social life and numerous skills, Iranian women are still severely underrepresented in political leadership positions. This is largely due to legal and social restrictions. For example, there are legal hurdles that largely exclude women from certain positions, such as the presidency.  

Whether Iranian women should remain passive or become active is essentially not a legal question, but an ethical and social one. **From a democratic, human rights and social perspective, it is not only their right, but essential that women stand up for their rights and for equal representation.

**Arguments for actively demanding one's own right to political participation:**

1 **Equality:** The international community and fundamental human rights demand equal rights and opportunities for all, regardless of gender.
2 **Social progress:** Countries in which women have a say in politics tend to have fairer and more sustainable development.
3. role model function:** Active women can be an inspiration and motivation for other generations to break barriers.
4 **Women's own interests:** Women are often particularly affected by political decisions. Without their voice, important perspectives and needs remain unconsidered.

**Possible challenges:**
- Resistance from conservative forces and possible repression
- Social pressure or discrimination
- Legal risks

**Recommendation:**
That Iranian women should rather "stand up and claim their rightful place" is ethically and factually justified. Even small steps - such as social engagement, education, networking and public advocacy for equality - can lead to change in the long term.

**Conclusion:**
Passivity perpetuates existing inequalities. Commitment to equality is necessary, even if this is associated with risks. The collective commitment of women (and supportive men) in politics, education and the public sphere is a decisive driver for social change towards more justice and equality.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: Las mujeres iraníes están infrarrepresentadas en el liderazgo político debido a las barreras legales. ¿Deben permanecer pasivas o alzarse para exigir el lugar que les corresponde en los puestos de toma de decisiones?
Reply:
Tu planteamiento aborda una realidad compleja en Irán y en muchas otras sociedades: las mujeres enfrentan barreras legales, culturales y sociales que limitan su representación en el liderazgo político. 

**Responder a la afirmación:**

Desde una perspectiva de derechos humanos y equidad, las mujeres no deben permanecer pasivas ante la infrarrepresentación. Al contrario, **es fundamental que se organicen, alcen la voz y exijan el lugar que legítimamente les corresponde en los espacios de toma de decisiones**. La participación activa de las mujeres en la política es crucial no solo para su propio desarrollo, sino también para la construcción de sociedades más justas, democráticas y representativas.

Las barreras legales y culturales requieren resistencia y demanda de cambios, tanto desde dentro (movilización social, activismo, creación de redes) como desde el apoyo internacional. A lo largo de la historia, los avances en derechos de las mujeres —incluido el sufragio, el acceso a la educación y la participación política— se han logrado a través del esfuerzo colectivo, la movilización y la persistencia ante la adversidad.

**Conclusión:**  
No deben permanecer pasivas. El cambio es posible y legítimo cuando las mujeres exigen y luchan activamente por sus derechos, abriendo el camino para futuras generaciones y contribuyendo a una sociedad más equitativa.

**Dato adicional:**  
Aunque las mujeres en Irán han alcanzado altos niveles educativos y desempeñan roles fundamentales en la sociedad, su representación en órganos políticos sigue siendo baja, principalmente por restricciones legales y obstáculos culturales. Apoyar, visibilizar y ampliar su participación resulta clave para la transformación social.

EnglishTranslation:
Your approach addresses a complex reality in Iran and in many other societies: women face legal, cultural and social barriers that limit their representation in political leadership.

**Respond to the statement:**

From a human rights and equity perspective, women should not remain passive in the face of underrepresentation. On the contrary, **it is essential that they organize themselves, raise their voices and demand their rightful place in decision-making spaces**. Women's active participation in politics is crucial not only for their own development, but also for the construction of fairer, more democratic and representative societies.

Legal and cultural barriers require resistance and demand for change, both from within (social mobilization, activism, networking) and from international support. Throughout history, advances in women's rights - including suffrage, access to education and political participation - have been achieved through collective effort, mobilization and persistence in the face of adversity.

**Conclusion.
They must not remain passive. Change is possible and legitimate when women actively demand and fight for their rights, paving the way for future generations and contributing to a more equitable society.

Additional Fact:** **
Although women in Iran have achieved high levels of education and play key roles in society, their representation in political bodies remains low, mainly due to legal restrictions and cultural obstacles. Supporting, making visible and expanding their participation is key to social transformation.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Reply:
Iranian women face significant legal, cultural, and institutional barriers to political leadership, including discriminatory laws and social norms that limit their participation. Remaining passive would only reinforce the status quo and maintain these barriers. History shows that significant progress in women's rights—whether in Iran or around the world—has often come as a result of collective action, advocacy, and persistent demands for equality.

It is both reasonable and necessary for Iranian women to raise their voices and advocate for their rightful place in political decision-making. This doesn’t have to mean confrontation alone; it can involve building alliances, raising awareness, educating communities, and seeking change through political, social, and legal channels. The ultimate goal should be a more equitable and just society, where women’s talents, perspectives, and leadership are not just welcomed but actively sought after.

Rising up does not necessarily mean violent revolt; it means mobilizing for rights through peaceful protest, civic engagement, strategic advocacy, and, when possible, participation in the political process. By demanding their place, Iranian women are not only working for their own empowerment but also for the broader advancement and well-being of their society.

Statement_Language: İranlı kadınlar yasal engeller nedeniyle siyasi liderlikte yeterince temsil edilmiyor. Pasif mi kalmalılar yoksa karar alma pozisyonlarında hak ettikleri yeri talep etmek için ayağa mı kalkmalılar?
Reply:
Bu ifadeye şöyle cevap verilebilir:  

"İranlı kadınların siyasi liderlikte yeterince temsil edilmemesi ciddi bir eşitsizlik sorunudur. Kadınlar, potansiyellerini ve haklarını tam anlamıyla kullanabilmek için pasif kalmamalı, aksine karar alma pozisyonlarında hak ettikleri yeri talep etmek adına seslerini yükseltmeli ve örgütlenmelidir. Tarih boyunca birçok toplumsal ilerleme, hak arayışında ısrarcı olan kadınların ve onların destekçilerinin çabaları sayesinde mümkün olmuştur. Dolayısıyla İranlı kadınların, yasal engellere rağmen meşru yollarla mücadele etmeleri ve toplumsal değişim için aktif rol almaları çok değerlidir."

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: Иранские женщины недостаточно представлены в политическом руководстве из-за юридических барьеров. Должны ли они оставаться пассивными или восстать и потребовать себе законное место на руководящих постах?
Reply:
Спасибо за ваше утверждение и вопрос.

**Суть утверждения:**  
Иранские женщины недостаточно представлены в политическом руководстве из-за юридических барьеров. Должны ли они оставаться пассивными или восстать и требовать свое место?

**Экспертный ответ:**

Недостаточная представленность женщин в руководстве Ирана действительно обусловлена как юридическими, так и культурными барьерами. Конституция и избирательное законодательство страны ограничивают женщин в занятии ряда высших постов — например, женщина не может стать Верховным лидером или судьей по уголовным делам; участие женщин в выборах на пост президента интерпретируется неоднозначно. Помимо этого, действует и фактор традиций, культурных стереотипов и давления.

**О пассивности и активности:**
- Пассивность женщин в таких условиях способствует закреплению статус-кво и сохранению того же уровня дискриминации.
- Мирные и законные формы борьбы за свои права — например, образовывать женские сообщества, участвовать в политической жизни, использовать медиа и международные площадки — могут привести к постепенным, но существенным переменам. История российских, европейских, индийских и других движений показывает, что именно активная гражданская позиция женщин способствует расширению их прав и возможностей.
- При этом важно учитывать контекст страны: прямое "восстание" может привести к негативным последствиям, включая репрессии. Поэтому акцент рекомендуется делать на осознанной, солидарной и стратегически выстроенной борьбе за права.

**Вывод:**  
Женщины не должны оставаться пассивными, если стремятся к изменению ситуации, но их действия должны быть осознанными, мирными и направленными на долгосрочные преобразования. Прогресс невозможен без настойчивых и солидарных усилий самих женщин и поддержки их со стороны общества.

**Кратко:**  
Пассивность ведет к стагнации. Активная, мирная и стратегическая борьба за права — путь к переменам и справедливому представительству женщин в политике.
API_Response:

EnglishTranslation:
Thank you for your assertion and question.

**Substance of the assertion:**
Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership because of legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up and demand their place?

**Expert Answer:**

The underrepresentation of women in leadership in Iran is indeed due to both legal and cultural barriers. The country's constitution and electoral laws restrict women from holding a number of top positions - for example, a woman cannot become Supreme Leader or a criminal judge; women's participation in presidential elections is interpreted ambiguously. In addition, there is a factor of tradition, cultural stereotypes and pressure.

**On passivity and activity:**
- Women's passivity in such conditions contributes to the consolidation of the status quo and the same level of discrimination.
- Peaceful and legitimate forms of struggle for their rights - for example, forming women's communities, political participation, use of media and international platforms - can lead to gradual but significant changes. The history of Russian, European, Indian and other movements shows that it is women's active citizenship that contributes to their empowerment.
- At the same time, it is important to take into account the context of the country: direct "rebellion" can lead to negative consequences, including repression. It is therefore advisable to emphasize conscious, solidarity-based and strategized struggle for rights.

**Conclusion:**
Women should not remain passive if they seek to make a difference, but their actions must be conscious, peaceful and aimed at lasting change. There can be no progress without the persistent and solidarity efforts of women themselves and the support of society.

**Summary:**
Passivity leads to stagnation. Active, peaceful and strategic struggle for rights is the path to change and equitable representation of women in politics.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: कानूनी बाधाओं के कारण ईरानी महिलाओं को राजनीतिक नेतृत्व में शामिल किया गया है।क्या उन्हें निर्णय लेने की स्थिति में अपने सही स्थान की मांग करने के लिए निष्क्रिय रहना चाहिए या उठना चाहिए?
Reply:
आपके दिए गए बयान का उत्तर निम्न प्रकार से दिया जा सकता है:

"कानूनी बाधाओं के बावजूद ईरानी महिलाओं को राजनीतिक नेतृत्व में शामिल किया गया है, लेकिन यह सच है कि वे अब भी कई स्तरों पर निर्णय लेने की वास्तविक शक्ति से वंचित हैं। ऐसी स्थिति में महिलाओं के पास दो विकल्प हैं: या तो वे निष्क्रिय रहें, या फिर अपने अधिकारों के लिए शांतिपूर्ण और संवैधानिक तरीके से आवाज उठाएं।

इतिहास गवाह है कि जब महिलाओं ने एकजुट होकर अपने अधिकारों की मांग की है, तो समाज में सकारात्मक परिवर्तन संभव हुए हैं। निष्क्रियता केवल मौजूदा असमानता को बनाए रखेगी। इसलिए, महिलाओं को अपने राज्य, समाज और कानूनी व्यवस्था के दायरे में रहते हुए, अपने सही स्थान की मांग मुखर और संगठित तरीकों से करनी चाहिए। 

वक्ता रूप में कह सकते हैं:  
'ईरानी महिलाओं को निष्क्रिय नहीं रहना चाहिए। परिवर्तन तभी संभव है, जब हम अपने अधिकारों और न्यायसंगत भागीदारी की मांग करें। प्रत्येक महिला को चाहिए कि वह शिक्षा, जागरुकता और सहमति निर्माण जैसे शांतिपूर्ण तरीके अपनाकर समाज में अपने योगदान और नेतृत्व को हासिल करने की दिशा में कदम बढ़ाए।'"

अगर आपको अधिक तर्क या उदाहरणों सहित उत्तर चाहिए, तो कृपया बताएं।

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: As mulheres iranianas estão sub-representadas na liderança política devido a barreiras legais. Elas devem permanecer passivas ou se levantar para exigir seu lugar de direito nos cargos de tomada de decisão?
Reply:
Como especialista em responder afirmações, posso analisar sua declaração sob os aspectos históricos, jurídicos, sociais e de direitos humanos:

**1. Sub-representação de mulheres iranianas na liderança política:**  
De fato, historicamente, as mulheres no Irã têm enfrentado sub-representação em cargos políticos de alto nível. A participação feminina no Parlamento e em outras posições decisórias permanece baixa se comparada a outros países, incluindo alguns de maioria muçulmana. Parte disso se deve a obstáculos legais e constitucionais, como interpretações restritivas do termo "rajol-e-siasi" (homem político), que limitam o acesso de mulheres a cargos como a presidência.

**2. Barreiras legais:**  
Existem diversas barreiras formais e informais. Além da legislação, fatores culturais, sociais e políticos também desempenham um papel importante. A legislação eleitoral, algumas interpretações da lei islâmica, requisitos de elegibilidade e o filtro do Conselho dos Guardiães são exemplos de impeditivos oficiais para mulheres.

**3. Passividade versus ação:**  
Sugerir que as mulheres “devem permanecer passivas” contradiz princípios básicos de igualdade e direitos humanos universais, reconhecidos inclusive por tratados internacionais dos quais o Irã é signatário, como o Pacto Internacional sobre Direitos Civis e Políticos.

**4. Direitos e Empoderamento:**  
As mulheres têm o direito fundamental de participação política, portanto, levantar-se para exigir igualdade não só é legítimo, como é parte essencial de qualquer sociedade que busca progresso e justiça. Movimentos globais e exemplos locais mostram que avanços na participação política ocorrem principalmente quando grupos marginalizados se mobilizam e reivindicam, de maneira pacífica e estruturada, seus direitos.

**5. Exemplos práticos:**  
Apesar das barreiras, muitas mulheres iranianas têm ocupado papéis importantes na sociedade civil, no parlamento e no setor público local. A pressão por mudanças legais e constitucionais já está presente na sociedade iraniana, impulsionada pela educação, acesso à informação e conexão com movimentos mundiais por igualdade de gênero.

**Conclusão:**  
As mulheres iranianas, como qualquer outro grupo, devem ter o direito de se levantar, exigir e conquistar seu lugar em cargos de decisão. Não há justificativa ética, política ou social para defender a passividade frente à exclusão, especialmente quando há um evidente déficit democrático e de representação.

**Resumo final:**  
Portanto, frente às barreiras legais e à sub-representação, o caminho justo e coerente é que as mulheres se mobilizem para reivindicar participação igualitária na liderança política. O progresso social e democrático depende dessa luta.

EnglishTranslation:
As an expert in responding to statements, I can analyze your statement from a historical, legal, social and human rights perspective:

**1. Under-representation of Iranian women in political leadership:**
In fact, historically, women in Iran have faced under-representation in high-level political positions. Female participation in parliament and other decision-making positions remains low compared to other countries, including some Muslim-majority ones. Part of this is due to legal and constitutional obstacles, such as restrictive interpretations of the term "rajol-e-siasi" (political man), which limit women's access to positions such as the presidency.

**2. Legal barriers:**
There are various formal and informal barriers. In addition to legislation, cultural, social and political factors also play an important role. Electoral legislation, some interpretations of Islamic law, eligibility requirements and the filter of the Council of Guardians are examples of official impediments for women.

**3. Passivity versus action:**
Suggesting that women "should remain passive" contradicts basic principles of equality and universal human rights, recognized even by international treaties to which Iran is a signatory, such as the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.

**4. Rights and Empowerment:**
Women have the fundamental right to political participation, so standing up to demand equality is not only legitimate, it is an essential part of any society that seeks progress and justice. Global movements and local examples show that advances in political participation occur mainly when marginalized groups mobilize and demand their rights in a peaceful and structured way.

**5. Practical examples:**
Despite the barriers, many Iranian women have taken on important roles in civil society, parliament and the local public sector. The pressure for legal and constitutional changes is already present in Iranian society, driven by education, access to information and connections with global movements for gender equality.

**Conclusion
Iranian women, like any other group, must have the right to stand up, demand and win their place in decision-making positions. There is no ethical, political or social justification for defending passivity in the face of exclusion, especially when there is a clear democratic and representation deficit.

**Final summary
Therefore, in the face of legal barriers and under-representation, the fair and coherent way forward is for women to mobilize to demand equal participation in political leadership. Social and democratic progress depends on this struggle.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: Abesifazane base-Iranian bafakwa ebuholini bezepolitiki ngenxa yezithiyo zomthetho.Ngabe kufanele bahlale bebona noma basukume bafune indawo yabo efanele ezikhundleni ezithatha izinqumo?
Reply:
Lesi sitatimende sithinta udaba olubalulekile mayelana nendawo yabesifazane kwezepolitiki e-Iran. Kuliqiniso ukuthi abesifazane e-Iran bahlangabezana nezithiyo eziningi zomthetho nezikamasiko ezibavimbela ukuba bathathe izikhundla eziphezulu kwezepolitiki nasekuthathweni kwezinqumo. Imithetho eqinile emayelana nendima yabantu owesifazane empilweni yomphakathi, kanye nemikhuba yesiko, ivamise ukunqamula amathuba abo okuba izikhulu eziphezulu.

Ukubhekana nale nselelo, akufanele abesifazane bahlale bebukele noma bavume isimo. Kufanele basukume, bafune indawo yabo efanele, futhi balwele ukufaka isandla ezinqumweni ezithinta impilo yabo nezesizwe. Lokhu kungafinyelelwa ngezindlela ezahlukene ezifana nokuzimbandakanya kwezombusazwe, ukufundisa imiphakathi ngamathuba alinganayo nokuqinisa imithetho elwa nobandlululo lobulili.

Ngakho-ke, abesifazane base-Iran kufanele bakhuthale, basebenzise amakhono abo, baphonse inselelo ezithiyweni, futhi bafune amathuba okuhola, ngoba ilungelo labo njengabantu ukuthi babe yingxenye yokuthathwa kwezinqumo ezinkulu ezithinta ikusasa labo nezwe lonke. Ukuba khona kwabantu abohlukene ebuholini kuthuthukisa izinqumo ezithathwayo futhi kuthuthukisa intando yeningi yangempela.

Strong laws relating to the roles of a woman in public health, as well as cultural habits, often terminate their chiefs.

Dealing with this challenge, should not be watching or accepting the situation. They should get up, seek their proper place, and fight to contribute to decisions affecting their health and the national health. This can be achieved in different ways such as political, communities are equal opportunities and strengthen the laws against sexual prejudice.

Therefore, Iran women should be diligent, using their skills, and challenge the tribes, and look for opportunities to lead, for their right as people are to be taken into the worldwide decision. The existence of various people in the lead also improve the decisions taken and promote real democracy.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: Iraanse vroue word onder politieke leierskap onderverteenwoordig weens wettige hindernisse.Moet hulle passief bly of opstaan ​​om hul regmatige plek in besluitnemingsposisies te eis?
Reply:
Hier is 'n voorbeeld van hoe om as 'n kenner op hierdie stelling te reageer:

Jy stel 'n baie belangrike kwessie aan die orde. Die onderverteenwoordiging van Iraanse vroue in politieke leierskapsposisies is inderdaad 'n bron van kommer en word hoofsaaklik toegeskryf aan 'n kombinasie van sosiale norme en institusionele, insluitend wettige, hindernisse. Verskeie wette en regulasies in Iran plaas beperkinge op die tipes poste wat vroue mag beklee, en kulturele verwagtings speel verder 'n rol in hul onderverteenwoordiging.

Die vraag of vroue passief moet bly of moet opstaan vir hul regte, is sentraal tot die kwessie van sosiale geregtigheid. Geskiedenis, beide internasionaal en in Iran self, het getoon dat betekenisvolle positiewe verandering dikwels slegs plaasvind wanneer individue en groepe proaktief staan teen onreg en vir hul regte baklei. Vroue se deelname aan protesbewegings, aktivisme, en politieke mobilisering het al reeds tot sekere vooruitgang gelei, alhoewel dit dikwels teenstand ontlok.

Hoewel die uitdagings aansienlik is, toon die ervaring wêreldwyd dat die eise vir gelykheid en inklusiwiteit uiteindelik dra tot ‘n meer regverdige en gebalanseerde samelewing. Indien Iraanse vroue voorts opstaan en hul regmatige plek in besluitnemingsposisies eis — al is dit riskant — bou hulle nie net aan 'n beter toekoms vir hulself nie, maar ook vir die breër samelewing.

Om dus jou stelling saam te vat: Passiwiteit bevestig die status quo, terwyl geregtigde optrede — selfs al is dit geleidelik — kan lei tot diepgaande verandering. Die keuse om op te staan is nie net geregverdig nie, maar ook noodsaaklik vir die bevordering van ware gelykheid.

EnglishTranslation:
Here is an example of how to respond to this statement as an expert:

You raise a very important issue. Indeed, the under -representation of Iranian women in political leadership positions is a concern and is mainly attributed to a combination of social norms and institutional, including legal, obstacles. Various laws and regulations in Iran place restrictions on the types of posts that women may hold, and cultural expectations further play a role in their under -representation.

The question of whether women should remain passive or stand up for their rights is central to the issue of social justice. History, both internationally and in Iran itself, has shown that significant positive change often occurs only when individuals and groups are proactive in injustice and fight for their rights. Women's participation in protest movements, activism, and political mobilization have already led to certain progress, although it often provokes opposition.

Although the challenges are considerable, the experience worldwide shows that the demands for equality and inclusivity ultimately carry to a more just and balanced society. If Iranian women also rise and demand their rightful place in decision -making positions - albeit risky - they are building not only to a better future for themselves, but also for the wider society.

So to summarize your statement: Passivity confirms the status quo, while entitled action - even if gradually - can lead to profound change. The choice to stand up is not only justified, but also essential for the promotion of true equality.

Statement_English: Iranian women are underrepresented in political leadership due to legal barriers. Should they remain passive or rise up to demand their rightful place in decision-making positions?
Statement_Language: به دلیل موانع قانونی ، زنان ایرانی در رهبری سیاسی کمتر نماینده هستند.آیا آنها باید منفعل باقی بمانند یا برخیزند تا جایگاه حق خود را در مواضع تصمیم گیری خواستار شوند؟
Reply:
پاسخ (در نقش متخصص):

قطعا زنان نباید منفعل باقی بمانند. اگرچه موانع قانونی و ساختاری در برابر حضور زنان در رهبری سیاسی در ایران وجود دارد، اما تاریخ نشان داده که تغییرات اجتماعی و سیاسی عمدتاً از طریق فعال شدن، مطالبه‌گری و تلاش مستمر اقشار مختلف جامعه—از جمله زنان—به وجود آمده است. بیداری و مشارکت فعال زنان نه تنها به نفع خود آنها، بلکه به سود کل جامعه است؛ زیرا تنوع جنسیتی در تصمیم‌گیری‌ها کیفیت سیاست‌گذاری را ارتقاء می‌دهد و دموکراسی را پویا‌تر می‌کند.

البته این فعالیت می‌تواند به اشکال مختلفی انجام شود: از مطالبه‌گری در جامعه مدنی و فعالیت‌های فرهنگی و اجتماعی گرفته تا آموزش، شبکه‌سازی، و حضور مؤثر در حوزه‌های سیاسی و اقتصادی. زنان می‌توانند و باید از تمامی روش‌های مسالمت‌آمیز برای ایجاد تغییر بهره ببرند، اعم از آگاهی‌بخشی، مشارکت در انتخابات، کاندیداتوری، مطالبه اصلاح قوانین، و حمایت از یکدیگر در عرصه‌های گوناگون.

در نهایت، انفعال تنها به تقویت وضعیت موجود و تداوم تبعیض کمک می‌کند. تحرک و مطالبه‌گری مسئولانه و هوشمندانه، راه تحقق حقوق و افزایش نمایندگی زنان در سطوح تصمیم‌گیری است.

EnglishTranslation:
Answer (in the role of expert):

Certainly women should not remain passive. Although there are legal and structural barriers to the presence of women in political leadership in Iran, history has shown that social and political change has been largely existed through the activation, demanding and efforts of different segments of society - including women. Awakening and active participation of women is not only for their own benefit but to the benefit of the whole community; Because gender diversity in decision -making improves the quality of policy making and makes democracy more dynamic.

Of course, this can be done in many ways: from demanding in civil society and cultural and social activities to education, networking, and effective presence in political and economic fields. Women can and should benefit from all peaceful ways to make change, including awareness, election participation, candidacy, demanding law reform, and supporting each other in various fields.

Finally, passivity only helps to strengthen the status quo and continue discrimination. Responsible and clever mobility and demand is the way to realize rights and increase women's representation at the decision -making levels.

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: هل ينتهك برنامج إيران النووي العديد من المعاهدات الدولية؟
Reply:
بالطبع! إليك ردًا دقيقًا وموضوعيًا على هذه العبارة:

برنامج إيران النووي مثار جدل عالمي، ومسألة ما إذا كان ينتهك العديد من المعاهدات الدولية تعتمد على التفسير القانوني والسياسي لتصرفات إيران والاتفاقيات الدولية ذات الصلة. إيران طرف في معاهدة عدم انتشار الأسلحة النووية (NPT)، ويحق لها بموجبها تطوير برنامج نووي سلمي تحت إشراف الوكالة الدولية للطاقة الذرية (IAEA). ومع ذلك، هناك اتهامات من بعض الدول بأن إيران لم تلتزم دائمًا بشكل كامل بمتطلبات الشفافية والتفتيش الواردة في المعاهدة.

حتى الآن، لم تثبت الوكالة الدولية للطاقة الذرية بشكل قاطع أن إيران انتهكت المعاهدة نفسها، لكنها أشارت في عدة تقارير إلى "مخاوف بشأن إمكانية وجود أنشطة نووية غير معلنة". بالنسبة للاتفاق النووي (خطة العمل الشاملة المشتركة – JCPOA) المبرم عام 2015، فهو ليس معاهدة دولية وإنما اتفاق سياسي، وقد انسحبت منه الولايات المتحدة في 2018، مما زاد من تعقيد الوضع.

باختصار: من الناحية القانونية، لا يوجد إجماع دولي على أن إيران تنتهك معاهدات دولية متعددة، لكن هناك جدل حول مدى التزامها الكامل بمتطلبات معاهدة عدم الانتشار، وهناك قلق دولي مستمر ومطالبات بمزيد من الشفافية والتعاون مع الوكالة الدولية للطاقة الذرية.

EnglishTranslation:
Of course! Here's an accurate and objective response to this statement:

Iran's nuclear program is globally controversial, and the question of whether it violates various international treaties depends on the legal and political interpretation of Iran's actions and the relevant international agreements. Iran is a party to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT), under which it is entitled to develop a peaceful nuclear program under the supervision of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). However, there are accusations from some countries that Iran has not always fully complied with the treaty's transparency and inspection requirements.

To date, the IAEA has not conclusively proven that Iran has violated the treaty itself, but in several reports it has noted "concerns about the possibility of undeclared nuclear activities." As for the 2015 nuclear deal (Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action - JCPOA), which is not an international treaty but a political agreement, the United States withdrew from it in 2018, further complicating the situation.

To summarize: Legally, there is no international consensus that Iran is violating multiple international treaties, but there is debate about the extent to which it is fully complying with NPT requirements, and there is ongoing international concern and demands for greater transparency and cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Reply:
Iran's nuclear program is a subject of ongoing international scrutiny, but whether it is in violation of "several international treaties" is nuanced.

**Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT):**  
Iran is a signatory of the NPT, which allows for peaceful nuclear activities under strict International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) oversight. Iran has consistently stated that its program is for peaceful purposes. However, there have been periods when the IAEA reported that Iran was not fully cooperative or transparent, leading to concerns about possible undeclared activities.

**Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA):**  
In 2015, Iran agreed to the JCPOA (the "Iran nuclear deal") with several world powers, which imposed further restrictions and monitoring on Iran's nuclear program. The United States withdrew from the JCPOA in 2018, and since then, Iran has gradually reduced its compliance with the deal's provisions. The JCPOA itself is not an international treaty but rather a political agreement. 

**Other Treaties:**  
Iran is not party to the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT, though it has signed but not ratified it). It is also not subject to treaties that explicitly prohibit uranium enrichment for peaceful purposes.

**Summary:**  
Iran is not generally recognized to be in violation of the NPT (the primary relevant treaty), though there have been serious questions about its compliance with IAEA safeguards and reporting requirements. The main issue has revolved around trust, transparency, and adherence to agreements like the JCPOA—which is not itself a treaty under international law.  

**In short:**  
Allegations that Iran is in violation of "several international treaties" are not fully supported by the current facts. However, there have been periods of non-compliance or incomplete cooperation with international oversight mechanisms, which has caused significant concern among the international community.

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: ¿Viola el programa nuclear iraní varios tratados internacionales?
Reply:
Claro, aquí tienes una respuesta experta y matizada a la afirmación: "¿Viola el programa nuclear iraní varios tratados internacionales?"

---

**Respuesta:**

El programa nuclear iraní ha sido objeto de un intenso escrutinio internacional, pero afirmar que viola "varios tratados internacionales" requiere matizar y precisar la información:

1. **Tratado de No Proliferación Nuclear (TNP):**
   - Irán es miembro del TNP desde 1970. Según el TNP, tiene derecho a desarrollar energía nuclear para fines pacíficos, pero está obligado a no desarrollar armas nucleares y a permitir inspecciones por parte del Organismo Internacional de Energía Atómica (OIEA).
   - El OIEA ha reportado en varias ocasiones falta de transparencia y cumplimiento total por parte de Irán en sus obligaciones de supervisión, especialmente antes de 2015. Sin embargo, oficialmente, no ha declarado categóricamente que Irán ha producido armas nucleares o material nuclear para fines militares.

2. **Acuerdo Nuclear de 2015 (JCPOA):**
   - El Plan de Acción Integral Conjunto (JCPOA) no era un tratado internacional, sino un acuerdo político entre Irán y el llamado P5+1 (China, Francia, Rusia, Reino Unido, Estados Unidos y Alemania).
   - Tras la retirada de Estados Unidos en 2018 y la restauración de sanciones unilaterales, Irán anunció incumplimientos parciales de sus compromisos del JCPOA. Técnicamente, esto constituye una violación del acuerdo, pero no de un tratado internacional formalmente vinculante como el TNP.

3. **OIEA y otros tratados relevantes:**
   - Irán ha sido acusado de no informar adecuadamente sobre ciertas instalaciones nucleares y actividades, lo cual contraviene acuerdos adicionales (como el Protocolo Adicional del OIEA, que Irán firmó pero no ratificó permanentemente). Sin embargo, el incumplimiento de estos compromisos complementarios, aunque problemático, no equivale automáticamente a una violación del TNP.
   - No existe hasta hoy evidencia pública concluyente de que Irán haya fabricado armas nucleares, lo que sería una clara violación del TNP.

**Conclusión:**  
El programa nuclear iraní ha generado incumplimientos o disputas respecto de sus obligaciones de transparencia y supervisión, y ha violado compromisos políticos específicos (como el JCPOA). No obstante, afirmar que viola "varios tratados internacionales" puede ser una generalización excesiva. La violación clara y formal de tratados como el TNP no ha sido determinada oficialmente por los organismos internacionales competentes hasta la fecha.

¿Te gustaría más información sobre algún aspecto específico, como el rol del OIEA o el JCPOA?

EnglishTranslation:
Sure, here's an expert and nuanced response to the statement, "Does Iran's nuclear program violate several international treaties?"

---

**Answer:**

Iran's nuclear program has been the subject of intense international scrutiny, but claiming that it violates "several international treaties" requires nuance and precision:

1. **Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT):** 2.
   - Iran has been a member of the NPT since 1970. Under the NPT, it has the right to develop nuclear energy for peaceful purposes, but is obliged not to develop nuclear weapons and to allow inspections by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
   - The IAEA has repeatedly reported lack of transparency and full compliance by Iran in its monitoring obligations, especially prior to 2015. Officially, however, it has not categorically stated that Iran has produced nuclear weapons or nuclear material for military purposes.

2. **2015 Nuclear Agreement (JCPOA):**.
   - The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) was not an international treaty, but a political agreement between Iran and the so-called P5+1 (China, France, Russia, United Kingdom, United States and Germany).
   - Following the U.S. withdrawal in 2018 and the restoration of unilateral sanctions, Iran announced partial breaches of its JCPOA commitments. Technically, this constitutes a violation of the agreement, but not of a formally binding international treaty such as the NPT.

3. **IAEA and other relevant treaties.
   - Iran has been accused of failing to adequately report certain nuclear facilities and activities, which contravenes additional agreements (such as the IAEA Additional Protocol, which Iran signed but did not permanently ratify). However, non-compliance with these supplementary commitments, while problematic, does not automatically amount to a violation of the NPT.
   - There is as yet no conclusive public evidence that Iran has developed nuclear weapons, which would be a clear violation of the NPT.

**Conclusion.
Iran's nuclear program has generated non-compliance or disputes regarding its transparency and monitoring obligations, and has violated specific political commitments (such as the JCPOA). However, to state that it violates "several international treaties" may be an overgeneralization. Clear and formal violation of treaties such as the NPT has not been formally determined by the relevant international bodies to date.

Would you like more information on any specific aspect, such as the role of the IAEA or the JCPOA?

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: 伊朗的核計劃是否違反了幾項國際條約？
Reply:
回應：

伊朗的核計劃是否違反了幾項國際條約，取決於所討論的具體國際條約以及相關國際組織的判定。以下是對此問題的詳細說明：

1. 《不擴散核武器條約》（NPT）

伊朗自1970年加入《不擴散核武器條約》（NPT），根據該條約，作為“無核武國家”一方，伊朗有權發展和平利用核能，但必須接受國際原子能機構（IAEA）的監督，確保其核活動不被用於軍事目的。  
伊朗曾一度未申報某些核設施與活動，根據IAEA報告，這些行為違反了其與IAEA的保障協定。但截至目前（2024年），IAEA並未證實伊朗有將核計劃用於製造核武的大規模違規行為。

2. 其他相關國際協議

除了NPT，伊朗於2015年與聯合國安理會五常及德國（P5+1）達成《聯合全面行動計劃》（JCPOA，俗稱伊朗核協議）。JCPOA不是正式國際條約，但為一項多邊協議。2018年美國單方面退出後，伊朗逐步減少履行協議承諾，引發國際關注，但從嚴格意義上說，這不屬於違反正式國際條約。

3. 聯合國安理會決議

聯合國安理會過去曾通過多項針對伊朗核計劃的決議，要求伊朗暫停包括濃縮鈾在內的部分核活動。伊朗在一段時期內沒有履行這些決議條款，這被國際社會普遍視為違反了聯合國安理會的國際義務。然而，這些決議多數與保障協定相聯，而非NPT條約主體本身。

總結：

伊朗的核計劃是否違反了幾項國際條約，主要爭議點在於：  
- 伊朗曾違反與IAEA的部分保障協定（這可被視為違反NPT框架下的執行協議）；  
- 沒有確鑿證據證明伊朗違反了NPT條約的禁止核武器義務；  
- 在某些時期未遵守聯合國安理會相關決議，這可被認為違反了特定國際義務。

綜上，可以說伊朗的核計劃出現過部分違反某些國際條約附屬協定或聯合國決議的行為，但是否違反NPT本身，國際間仍有不同解讀，取決於法律和政治判斷標準。

除了NPT，伊朗於2015年與聯合國安理會五常及德國（P5+1）達成《聯合全面行動計劃》（JCPOA，俗稱伊朗核協議）。JCPOA不是正式國際條約，但為一項多邊協議。2018年美國單方面退出後，伊朗逐步減少履行協議承諾，引發國際關注，但從嚴格意義上說，這不屬於違反正式國際條約。

3. 聯合國安理會決議

聯合國安理會過去曾通過多項針對伊朗核計劃的決議，要求伊朗暫停包括濃縮鈾在內的部分核活動。伊朗在一段時期內沒有履行這些決議條款，這被國際社會普遍視為違反了聯合國安理會的國際義務。然而，這些決議多數與保障協定相聯，而非NPT條約主體本身。

總結：

伊朗的核計劃是否違反了幾項國際條約，主要爭議點在於：  
- 伊朗曾違反與IAEA的部分保障協定（這可被視為違反NPT框架下的執行協議）；  
- 沒有確鑿證據證明伊朗違反了NPT條約的禁止核武器義務；  
- 在某些時期未遵守聯合國安理會相關決議，這可被認為違反了特定國際義務。

綜上，可以說伊朗的核計劃出現過部分違反某些國際條約附屬協定或聯合國決議的行為，但是否違反NPT本身，國際間仍有不同解讀，取決於法律和政治判斷標準。", "type": "output_text"}], "role": "assistant", "status": "completed", "type": "message"}], "parallel_tool_calls": true, "temperature": 1.0, "tool_choice": "auto", "tools": [], "top_p": 1.0, "max_output_tokens": null, "previous_response_id": null, "reasoning": {"effort": null, "summary": null}, "service_tier": "default", "status": "completed", "text": {"format": {"type": "text"}}, "truncation": "disabled", "usage": {"input_tokens": 44, "input_tokens_details": {"cached_tokens": 0}, "output_tokens": 683, "output_tokens_details": {"reasoning_tokens": 0}, "total_tokens": 727}, "user": null, "store": true}
EnglishTranslation:
Response:

Whether Iran's nuclear program violates several international contracts, decides on the specific international contracts discussed and the judgment of the relevant international organizations. Here is a detailed description of this problem:

1. "NPT" Agreement on the Non-Expansion of Nuclear Weapons

Iran has joined the "NPT" Agreement in 1970. According to this Agreement, as a "nuclear-free country", Iran has the right to develop and use nuclear energy peacefully, but must be supervised by the International Atomic Energy Institution (IAEA) to ensure that its nuclear activities are not used for military purposes.  
Iran has not declared certain nuclear facilities and activities for a time, and according to the IAEA report, these actions violated its safeguards agreement with the IAEA. But as of now (2024), IAEA has not proven that Iran has a large-scale illegal act of using nuclear plans to manufacture nuclear weapons.

2. Other relevant international agreements

In addition to the NPT, Iran reached the "JCPOA, commonly known as the Iran nuclear agreement) with the Five Constables of the United Nations Security Council and Germany (P5+1). The JCPOA is not a formal international agreement, but is a multi-sided agreement. After the US withdrawal from the 2018 US government, Iran gradually reduced its commitment to the implementation of the agreement, attracting international attention, but in strict meaning, this does not belong to a violation of the formal international contract.

3. United Nations Security Council Decisions

The United Nations Security Council has previously requested Iran to suspend some of its nuclear activities, including the Dulux. Iran has not fulfilled these terms of decisions for a period of time, which has been widely seen by international society as a violation of the United Nations Security Council's international obligations. However, these decisions are mostly associated with the safeguard agreement, not the NPT clause itself.

Total:

Whether Iran's nuclear program violates several international treaties, the main dispute is:
- Iran has violated part of its safeguards agreement with the IAEA (this can be seen as a violation of the enforcement agreement under the NPT framework);
- There is no confirmation that Iran violates the NPT agreement's ban on nuclear weapons;
- Failure to comply with UN Security Council relevant decisions during certain periods can be considered a violation of specific international obligations.

In general, it can be said that Iran's nuclear plan has partially violated certain international agreements or United Nations decisions, but whether it violates the NPT itself is still different internationally, depending on legal and political judgment standards.

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: 伊朗的核计划是否违反了多项国际条约？
Reply:
以下是作为回应言论专家针对“伊朗的核计划是否违反了多项国际条约？”这一言论的详细回应：

---

伊朗的核计划一直是国际社会关注的焦点，其是否违反了多项国际条约，需要从不同层面加以分析。

**1. 《不扩散核武器条约》(NPT)角度：**

伊朗是《不扩散核武器条约》（NPT）的签约国，理论上被允许发展和平利用核能，但不得发展核武器。根据国际原子能机构（IAEA）的多次报告，虽然伊朗在过去有一些未申报核活动和材料，但截至目前，没有确凿证据显示伊朗制造或拥有核武器。

不过，IAEA曾指出伊朗在核活动通报和透明度方面存在不足，这被部分国家解读为“未完全履行条约义务”，但这尚不等同于“明确违反NPT”。

**2. 联合国安理会决议：**

过去，由于伊朗未中止浓缩铀活动，联合国安理会通过了多项制裁决议，这些决议要求伊朗暂停某些敏感核活动。伊朗在某些阶段未完全遵守这些要求，可以说违反了安理会相关决议，虽然这些决议与国际条约是不同的法律文件，但国际社会同样高度重视。

**3. 《伊朗核问题全面协议》（即JCPOA）：**

2015年，伊朗与六国（中、美、俄、英、法、德）达成了JCPOA，对伊朗核计划进行了更为严格的限制。2018年美国单方面退出协议后，伊朗逐步减少履行协议义务。这被签署方认为是违反了JCPOA的承诺，但由于JCPOA本身不是一个国际条约，而是多边政治协议，所以这种“违反”更多属于政治和外交范畴。

**4. 结论性回应：**

简言之，伊朗被认为在一些方面违反了联合国安理会决议和JCPOA，曾在履行NPT的某些透明义务上存在争议和不足，但尚无铁证显示伊朗明确违反NPT（即发展核武器）。不同国家、国际组织对“违反”的判断标准和侧重点也不完全相同。因此，所谓“违反多项国际条约”的说法，需结合具体条约内容和各方立场予以客观看待。

---

如需进一步专业解读或历史背景，欢迎补充提问。

EnglishTranslation:
The following is a detailed response to the statement "Is Iran's Nuclear Program in Violation of Multiple International Treaties?" by the Response Experts. The following is a detailed response to the statement "Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of many international treaties?":

---

Iran's nuclear program has been the focus of international attention, and whether it violates many international treaties needs to be analyzed at different levels.

**1. The Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT) perspective:**

Iran is a signatory to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT) and is theoretically allowed to develop peaceful uses of nuclear energy, but not nuclear weapons. According to numerous reports by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), while Iran has had some undeclared nuclear activities and materials in the past, to date there is no conclusive evidence that Iran has manufactured or possessed nuclear weapons.

However, the IAEA has pointed out that Iran's shortcomings in notification and transparency of its nuclear activities have been interpreted by some countries as "incomplete fulfillment of its treaty obligations", which does not yet amount to a "clear violation of the NPT".

**2. UN Security Council Resolutions:**

In the past, Iran's failure to suspend uranium enrichment has led the UN Security Council to adopt a number of sanctions resolutions that require Iran to suspend certain sensitive nuclear activities. Iran's failure to fully comply with these requirements at certain stages arguably violates the relevant UNSC resolutions, which, although they are separate legal documents from international treaties, are equally highly valued by the international community.

**3. Iran's Comprehensive Nuclear Agreement, or JCPOA:**

In 2015, Iran and the six countries (China, the U.S., Russia, the U.K., France, and Germany) agreed to the JCPOA, which placed stricter restrictions on Iran's nuclear program.After the U.S. unilaterally withdrew from the deal in 2018, Iran gradually reduced its compliance with its obligations under the agreement. This is considered by the signatories as a violation of the JCPOA commitments, but since the JCPOA itself is not an international treaty but a multilateral political agreement, this "violation" is more in the political and diplomatic realm.

**4. Concluding response:**

In short, Iran is considered to have violated UNSCRs and the JCPOA in some ways, and there have been controversies and shortcomings in fulfilling some of the transparency obligations of the NPT, but there is no hard evidence of a clear violation of the NPT (i.e., the development of nuclear weapons). The criteria and focus of different countries and international organizations on "violation" are not exactly the same. Therefore, the so-called "violation of many international treaties" needs to be viewed objectively in the light of the content of specific treaties and the positions of various parties.

---

If you need further professional interpretation or historical background, please feel free to ask additional questions.

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: Verstößt das iranische Atomprogramm gegen mehrere internationale Verträge?
Reply:
Als KI-basierter Assistent mit Spezialisierung auf internationale Politik und Nichtverbreitung beantworte ich gerne Ihre Frage:

### Verstößt das iranische Atomprogramm gegen mehrere internationale Verträge?

#### 1. **Atomwaffensperrvertrag (NVV))
Der Iran ist seit 1970 Vertragsstaat des **Atomwaffensperrvertrags (NVV/NPT)**. Als Nicht-Atomwaffenstaat verpflichtet sich der Iran, keine Atomwaffen zu entwickeln oder zu erwerben. Der NVV erlaubt allerdings zivile Nutzung der Kernenergie, setzt aber strikte Kontrollen (IAEO-Kontrollen) voraus.

**Vorwürfe und Problematik:**
- **Der Iran hat mehrfach gegen Melde- und Kontrollauflagen verstoßen (vor allem in den frühen 2000ern),** indem er z.B. geheime Urananreicherungsanlagen nicht gemeldet hat.
- **Der IAEO zufolge gab und gibt es Hinweise auf nicht deklarierte Aktivitäten**, was dem Geist und teilweise dem Buchstaben des NVV widerspricht, aber eine direkte Herstellung von Atomwaffen wurde bisher nicht eindeutig nachgewiesen.
- **Derzeit (Stand 2024) verletzt der Iran die erweiterten Transparenz-bestimmungen des Wiener Atomabkommens von 2015 (JCPOA)**, die aber separate Zusatzvereinbarungen zum NVV sind und keine eigenen internationalen Verträge.

**Fazit zum NVV:**  
*Der Iran hat mehrfach gegen seine Transparenz- und Meldepflichten („Safeguards“) verstoßen, aber es gibt keine offizielle Feststellung, dass der Iran nukleare Sprengkörper gebaut oder einsatzbereit gemacht hat.*

---

#### 2. **Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA, Wiener Atomabkommen)**
Der **JCPOA von 2015** ist kein klassischer „internationaler Vertrag“, sondern ein völkerrechtliches Abkommen zwischen Iran und den P5+1 (UN-Sicherheitsratsmitglieder plus Deutschland) sowie der EU. Er verschärfte die Kontrollmaßnahmen und legte Zusatzauflagen für das iranische Atomprogramm fest.

- **Der Iran verletzt seit 2019 zunehmend die JCPOA-Bestimmungen** (höhere Urananreicherung, größere Lagermengen, Inbetriebnahme nicht genehmigter Zentrifugen).
- **Nach dem US-Ausstieg 2018 betrachtet Teheran die Einschränkungen als für sich nicht mehr bindend.**
- **Der JCPOA ist aber kein universeller völkerrechtlicher Vertrag wie der NVV**, sondern ein politisches Abkommen.

---

#### 3. **Sonstige Verträge**
- Der Iran ist nicht Mitglied anderer relevanter Abrüstungsregime, etwa **Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT)**, sodass hier kein Verstoß möglich ist.
- Auch dem Zusatzprotokoll der IAEO (erweiterte Kontrollen) folgt er seit 2021 nur noch eingeschränkt.

---

### **Zusammenfassung**

- **Der Iran hat mehrfach gegen Transparenz- und Kontrollauflagen des NVV/IAEO verstoßen.**  
- *Seit 2019 verstößt er gegen JCPOA-Bestimmungen* – einem völkerrechtlichen Politabkommen.
- **Es gibt keine gerichtsfeste Feststellung, dass der Iran gegen ein Verbot der Herstellung von Atomwaffen im engeren Sinne verstoßen hat.**  
- Die Situation bleibt Gegenstand internationaler Spannungen und politischer Bewertungen.

Wenn Sie einen noch tieferen rechtlichen oder diplomatischen Blick wünschen, kann ich diesen gerne liefern!

EnglishTranslation:
As an AI-based assistant specializing in international politics and non-proliferation, I am happy to answer your question:

### Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of multiple international treaties?

#### 1. **Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT))
Iran has been a state party to the **Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT)** since 1970. As a non-nuclear weapons state, Iran undertakes not to develop or acquire nuclear weapons. However, the NPT permits the civilian use of nuclear energy, but requires strict controls (IAEA controls).

**Allegations and problems:**
- Iran has repeatedly violated reporting and control requirements (especially in the early 2000s),** e.g. by not reporting secret uranium enrichment facilities.
- **According to the IAEA, there was and is evidence of undeclared activities**, which contradicts the spirit and partly the letter of the NPT, but direct production of nuclear weapons has not yet been clearly proven.
- Iran is currently (as of 2024) in violation of the extended transparency provisions of the 2015 Vienna Nuclear Agreement (JCPOA)**, which are separate additional agreements to the NPT and not international treaties in their own right.

**Conclusion on the NPT:**
*Iran has repeatedly violated its transparency and reporting obligations ("safeguards"), but there is no official finding that Iran has built or deployed nuclear explosive devices.

---

#### 2. **Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA, Vienna Nuclear Agreement)**
The **JCPOA of 2015** is not a classic "international treaty", but an agreement under international law between Iran and the P5+1 (UN Security Council members plus Germany) and the EU. It tightened the control measures and laid down additional conditions for the Iranian nuclear program.

- Iran has been increasingly violating the JCPOA provisions** since 2019 (higher uranium enrichment, larger storage quantities, commissioning of unauthorized centrifuges).
- Following the US withdrawal in 2018, Tehran no longer considers the restrictions to be binding on it
- However, the JCPOA is not a universal treaty under international law like the NPT**, but a political agreement.

---

#### 3 **Other treaties**
- Iran is not a member of other relevant disarmament regimes, such as the **Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT)**, so that no violation is possible here.
- It has also only complied with the IAEA Additional Protocol (extended controls) to a limited extent since 2021.

---

### **Summary**

- Iran has repeatedly violated transparency and control requirements of the NPT/IAEO.
- Since 2019, it has violated JCPOA provisions* - a political agreement under international law.
- There is no court finding that Iran has violated a ban on the production of nuclear weapons in the strict sense.
- The situation remains the subject of international tensions and political assessments.

If you want an even deeper legal or diplomatic view, I can provide it!

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: O programa nuclear do Irã está violando vários tratados internacionais?
Reply:
Claro! Aqui está uma resposta fundamentada para a afirmação:

**Afirmação**: "O programa nuclear do Irã está violando vários tratados internacionais?"

**Resposta:**

A situação do programa nuclear do Irã envolve nuances jurídicas e diplomáticas.

1. **Tratado de Não Proliferação Nuclear (TNP):**
   - O Irã é signatário do TNP desde 1970. O tratado permite que todos os países signatários desenvolvam tecnologia nuclear para fins pacíficos, mas proíbe o desenvolvimento de armas nucleares.
   - Ao longo dos anos, a Agência Internacional de Energia Atômica (AIEA) detectou falhas de transparência e omissões em declarações do Irã, o que foi interpretado como descumprimento de obrigações de salvaguardas do TNP, mas não como uma violação direta do tratado no sentido de desenvolvimento comprovado de armas nucleares.

2. **Acordo Nuclear de 2015 (JCPOA):**
   - Em 2015, o Irã e o grupo P5+1 (EUA, Reino Unido, França, Rússia, China e Alemanha) firmaram o Plano de Ação Conjunto Global (JCPOA), estabelecendo limites rigorosos para o programa nuclear do Irã em troca do alívio de sanções.
   - O Irã começou a descumprir partes do acordo após a retirada dos EUA em 2018 e a reimposição de sanções, restringindo o acesso de inspetores e aumentando o enriquecimento de urânio além do permitido no JCPOA. Contudo, o JCPOA não é um tratado internacional formal, mas sim um acordo político multilateral.

3. **Resoluções do Conselho de Segurança da ONU:**
   - O Conselho de Segurança da ONU emitiu várias resoluções exigindo que o Irã suspendesse certas atividades de enriquecimento.
   - Antes do JCPOA, o Irã não estava em conformidade com essas resoluções. Com o acordo, o Irã voltou temporariamente à conformidade, mas após 2018 voltou a descumpri-las.

**Conclusão:** 
- No momento, o Irã é acusado de violar algumas das suas obrigações internacionais relacionadas à transparência e ao acesso de inspetores sob o TNP e os termos do JCPOA. Contudo, ainda não há provas de que o Irã esteja, de fato, fabricando armas nucleares, o que seria uma violação grave do TNP.
- Portanto, a afirmação de que o Irã está “violando vários tratados” é parcialmente verdadeira: há descumprimentos de acordos e de obrigações com a AIEA, e de resoluções da ONU, mas há debate sobre a extensão e a gravidade dessas violações quanto ao texto do TNP.

Se precisar de uma resposta mais resumida ou com fontes, posso detalhar!

EnglishTranslation:
Of course! Here's a reasoned response to the statement:

**Affirmation**: "Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?"

**Answer:**

The situation regarding Iran's nuclear program involves legal and diplomatic nuances.

1. **Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT):**
   - Iran has been a signatory to the NPT since 1970. The treaty allows all signatory countries to develop nuclear technology for peaceful purposes, but prohibits the development of nuclear weapons.
   - Over the years, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has detected transparency gaps and omissions in Iran's declarations, which have been interpreted as non-compliance with NPT safeguards obligations, but not as a direct violation of the treaty in the sense of proven development of nuclear weapons.

2. **2015 Nuclear Agreement (JCPOA):**
   - In 2015, Iran and the P5+1 group (US, UK, France, Russia, China and Germany) signed the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), setting strict limits on Iran's nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.
   - Iran began to breach parts of the agreement after the US withdrawal in 2018 and the reimposition of sanctions, restricting access for inspectors and increasing uranium enrichment beyond that permitted in the JCPOA. However, the JCPOA is not a formal international treaty, but a multilateral political agreement.

3. **UN Security Council resolutions:**
   - The UN Security Council has issued several resolutions demanding that Iran suspend certain enrichment activities.
   - Before the JCPOA, Iran was not in compliance with these resolutions. With the agreement, Iran temporarily returned to compliance, but after 2018 it went back to non-compliance.

**Conclusion
- Iran is currently accused of violating some of its international obligations related to transparency and inspector access under the NPT and the terms of the JCPOA. However, there is still no evidence that Iran is actually manufacturing nuclear weapons, which would be a serious violation of the NPT.
- Therefore, the claim that Iran is "violating several treaties" is partly true: there are breaches of agreements and obligations with the IAEA, and of UN resolutions, but there is debate about the extent and seriousness of these violations in terms of the text of the NPT.

If you need a more succinct answer or sources, I can elaborate!

Statement_English: Is Iran's nuclear program in violation of several international treaties?
Statement_Language: क्या ईरान का परमाणु कार्यक्रम कई अंतरराष्ट्रीय संधियों के उल्लंघन में है?
Reply:
ईरान का परमाणु कार्यक्रम अंतरराष्ट्रीय स्तर पर काफी विवादास्पद रहा है। इस संबंध में मुख्य अंतरराष्ट्रीय संधि "परमाणु अप्रसार संधि" (NPT - Non-Proliferation Treaty) है, जिसके तहत ईरान को परमाणु हथियारों का विकास नहीं करना है, लेकिन शांतिपूर्ण उद्देश्यों के लिए परमाणु ऊर्जा का उपयोग कर सकता है। 

ईरान ने NPT पर हस्ताक्षर कर रखे हैं और उसका दावा है कि उसका परमाणु कार्यक्रम केवल शांतिपूर्ण उद्देश्यों के लिए है। हालांकि, अंतरराष्ट्रीय परमाणु ऊर्जा एजेंसी (IAEA) ने अपनी कुछ रिपोर्ट्स में चिंता जताई है कि ईरान ने अपने परमाणु कार्यक्रम से जुड़ी कुछ गतिविधियों और सूचनाओं को पूरी तरह पारदर्शी नहीं रखा, जिससे संधि के "सथापत्य दायित्वों" के संभावित उल्लंघन को लेकर सवाल उठे हैं।

इसके अलावा, संयुक्त राष्ट्र सुरक्षा परिषद ने भी कई प्रस्ताव पास किए थे, जिनमें ईरान से यूरेनियम संवर्धन गतिविधियों को रोकने की मांग की गई थी। कुछ मामलों में यह कहा गया कि ईरान ने इन प्रस्तावों और IAEA के दिशानिर्देशों का उल्लंघन किया है।

हालांकि, 2015 में हुआ "इस्तांबुल परमाणु समझौता" (JCPOA) ईरान और विश्व शक्तियों के बीच एक ऐसा समझौता था जो इन विवादों को सुलझाने का प्रयास था। लेकिन अमेरिका के 2018 में समझौते से अलग होने के बाद ईरान ने भी कुछ प्रतिबंधों का पालन करना बंद कर दिया, जिसके कारण फिर से उल्लंघन संबंधी आरोप लगे हैं।

**संक्षेप में:**  
ईरान का परमाणु कार्यक्रम आधिकारिक रूप से NPT का उल्लंघन नहीं माना गया है, लेकिन IAEA और संयुक्त राष्ट्र ने कई बार उसकी पारदर्शिता और सहयोग पर सवाल उठाए हैं तथा कुछ अंतरराष्ट्रीय प्रस्तावों के उल्लंघन का आरोप लगाया है। अंतिम फैसला परिस्थितियों और ताजा रिपोर्ट्स पर निर्भर करता है।
